Reviews.Title: Ex226 does everything as advertised
Reviews.Author: NoSciFi
Reviews.Content: A 5 star rate should be assigned whenever a product does all that it is advertised to do. Motorola ex226 is a phone that has all the features needed in a non-smart phone. Priced right, easy to use, dual SIM. Dual SIM is the reason I purchased this phone, it is my second phone from Motorola, my first ex115. EX226 combines touch screen and a full qwerty keyboard. A phone like this gives you the opportunity to buy a data plan from a North American cell phone company or not. The dual SIM gives you the opportunity to have both your comapany phone number and your personal phone being answered on the same phone. Elininates carrying two phones. The lines are completely seperate, two voice mail boxes, messages, contact lists, call history.There has been some who are not seeing the caller ID or NAme from the contact list. This is corrected by copying their contact list from the SIM card to the phone memory. There was someone stating in a previous review that it was too hard to create a message or see the lists. They did not tap on the arrow sysmbol at the top of the screen. The screen, as you can see, is the top half of the phone and then there is the shade. There is a small arrow at the top of the main scrren that when you tap on it a shade is pulled down and the alternat buttons appear, cool idea.Summary: Great phone, great battery, using it on AT&T; in USA, Dual SIM simultaneously, slim, light weight, easy to use.Emjoy!

Reviews.Title: Phone returned
Reviews.Author: Herbert R. Perkins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone to replace a still working Nokia E 62 phone.  I wanted a phone with a separate wifi that could be used occasionally and I definitely did not want to have to pay for a Data Plan with the newer smart phones. While the Motorola had that function, and it did work as I expected, it failed in several other areas.The phone was supplied in two days as advertised.  While it looked as if it were new,I found two messages in the message folder which leads me to believe that it was a return that is being resold. Nothing wrong with this as cosmetically the phone looked new but I do think it should be noted in the description.The wall charger that was supplied had European prongs and was supplied with an American adapter. This was a nuisance as I am confident that the first thing that would have gone missing was the adapter.When first plugged in, the charger would not work. Fortunately I had another charger that did work so I was able to charge the phone.In checking out the phone the first thing I found was that the instructions that came with it were good to get you started but did not give enough information about the numerous function in the phone. A long and very arduous search of the internet revealed that there seems to be no manual available. I went to youtube and found several videos that were helpful and with some play time, figured out how to use most of the functions.Next was to get my contacts from my old Nokia to the Motorola. Of course the easy way is to copy them to the SIM card and move the SIM card over. No joy as I had too many contacts in the Nokia but I did get some to transfer. However as this was not a real data transfer, you lost things like addresses and comments.This issue should have proven to be an inconvenience and turned into a deal killer.  I looked for a copy of the Motorola PC suite on line as this would both allow me to back up the contacts and to transfer them from a Nokia back up file on my laptop. After a good bit of difficulty I found a copy. It loaded OK but when I tried to use a USB cable to connect it to my laptop the program would not recognize the phone. I initially felt it was a bad cable so off to the store for a new cable.  Back home, the new cable  would not work either.I first thought that the USB connector on the phone was bad as I tried to read it from a laptop and a desktop computer and could not get it to work with either one. Therefore, the next option was to use the Bluetooth connection – off to the store to get a Bluetooth adapter.The adapter installed on the laptop and the phone sort of found the laptop but I found that getting the two to find each other in the time allotted by the phone to link to a blue tooth device was quite a trial and error affair. One they finally made a link I found that the phone is not supported by the Motorola PC suite. The software put up a message that the phone was not supported.As I still needed to get my contacts across from the Nokia, it was back to the store to get a memory card reader – (of course none of my cameras take the micro sd card so I had to buy a new reader.)Back home I was able to back up the Nokia on to a mini sd card and it could be read by my laptop. Good so far. The micro SD card could not be formatted by the phone and consequently could not be read or written to by the pc. So now I am at a dead end. No way to move contacts and saved SMS messages to the phone.I made several calls with the phone and call quality was good. It did sync with my headset and that too worked well. But overall I have to rate it poorly, just because of the problem with moving contacts into it. If you purchase the phone as a first phone and then add your contacts as you use it, I am confident it would work well. The wifi did work and connected to my home system. Again it is a smart phone that does not need a smart phone data plan and this is a big plus for me.I am returning the phone as it is worthless to me if I have to transfer all my contacts by hand. Also the problem with the wall charger turned out to be the European to USA adapter.  If you bring the transformer half way out of the adapter it will make contact and charge the phone. While this is a solution, it is not an acceptable one. I believe the phone should be supplied with a proper American wall charger even if the price of the phone has to go up a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: My all over the world phone
Reviews.Author: DrSparx "The Master of Sparx"
Reviews.Content: This is an unlocked dual SIM phone with wifi. One SIM has 3G capability. The radio is a very nice feature although you must have the headset connected to activate the radio. Recently used this phone in West Africa with no problems. You can select which SIM you want to use when placing a call or sending a txt. You can turn either SIM off or both SIMs on. Touch screen plus full keyboard. Battery lasts for days. Very light and small. This is a must have for international travelers.

Reviews.Title: great quad band phone!
Reviews.Author: Georgia C.
Reviews.Content: I got this for my parents who didn't need a smartphone, just a quad band phone that had a keypad for texting. They use it in Canada, US, and Asia (Hong Kong/Taiwan). Great phone. Very reliable. Battery life is solid and it feels well-made. Definitely not a crappy feeling phone. The body has a slightly rubberized coating which is nice. UI is slightly puzzling but just takes some getting used to (play around with the phone a bit!). I recommend buying a motorola charger separately for your country (or using a micro USB charger for your country) because it comes with a foreign charger (European?). This phone charges very reliably via the charger, but had some problems with charging it via USB, so just keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT! :)
Reviews.Author: Rivka
Reviews.Content: I just got my phone and I am already in love with it! It`s lite, thin, good touchscreen and very comfortable key board! Great ability to use 2 sim cards at the same time! Wifi + 3G. And all these for 80$ ! :) Exactly, what I needed!!!! I would definitely recommend this phone!

Reviews.Title: There are much better choices out ther
Reviews.Author: William H. Thompson "WhT122"
Reviews.Content: My wife picked out this phone because of the QWERTY keyboard. The keyboard is "okay" and the phone is acceptable but the user interface is horrible to the point of being unusable. The phone is *very* Facebook centric which is a problem. The phone should have a Facebook app but everything seems centered around Facebook. The screens are VERY minimally customizable so you cannot get the text message icon on the same screen as the address book. The touch screen is much more difficult to use than any touchscreen I've used before. I'm going to buy my wife a different phone and throw this in the drawer for emergency use only.

Reviews.Title: not user friendly and no support
Reviews.Author: maryapdx
Reviews.Content: The phone is not easy to use. The user's guide is a joke. I contacted Motorola technical support to find how to access the APN settings so I could edit them for my carrier and the technicians didn't know anything about the phone. Don't buy a Motorola phone.

Reviews.Title: Motorola EX226 Unlocked GSM Phone with Dual SIM
Reviews.Author: Rigoberto Lainez
Reviews.Content: Strong machine, keyboard qwerty is very good. Using a few words for a description: Motorola EX226 Unlocked GSM Phone with Dual SIM it's AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: the situation with Motorola to buy
Reviews.Author: yohan baloa
Reviews.Content: The phone has excellent features but my problem is that my phone system does not contain the option of Spanish in the lenjuaje as I do in that case

Reviews.Title: OMG, this phone has everything and more.
Reviews.Author: R.L "R.L."
Reviews.Content: I didn't need a smartphone, so this seemed like the perfect phone for me. It is a little more complicated than I would like, but I will learn to use all the features. It is more than I expected from a phone less then $100 and anyone could enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Motorola EX226
Reviews.Author: Suga
Reviews.Content: When I received this phone and turned it on, I was pleased that the English language was set, it works well, fits perfectly in the palm of my hand, easy to hold onto.I'm amazed at the sound quality of the music and its features.  Good quality phone for a great price.I am unhappy with the fact that, the charger is unsuitable for Bermuda's electrical outlets....I am using my HP Touch adapter to charge my phone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Carlos "CP"
Reviews.Content: with all the buzz for new phones, this one makes me really happy as i don't need to be tied up on a plan and can switch to any provider that can offer me a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Defective / Bulk Item (Breed is a wholesale)
Reviews.Author: Buyer101 "Thanks"
Reviews.Content: Item is listed NEW but arrived defective. The touch screen on left side unresponsive, does not come in ORIG box and missing original items (manual, headset), sim slot was VERY tight. Not typical unless this was refurbished (buyer beware of wholesale co.)  The process to attain exchange took about 2 weeks - They did not have more in stock so processed a refund.I was not impressed by BREED product as this should have been stated - NEW (but will not include ORIGINAL content.. etc..)  If they stated this - I would avoid buying it and NOT be troubled with 2 weeks of email and wait time for them to take action.I knew content was incomplete because I have the same unit and wanted to buy a spare.  Will Not purchase from this company again.  ALSO.. TIP -- I will now buy FULFILLED BY AMAZON to attain immediate response & hassle free transaction.  It's so worth it to go with FULFILLED by Amazon if you can!!!  Trust me.. You save TIME and $$$.

Reviews.Title: Motorola EX226 or Motorola Motokey Social???
Reviews.Author: frobinson
Reviews.Content: The reason I purchaced this phone is becasue I had one about 2 years ago and it was great. Basic calling was all I needed while traveling. I didn't need all the fancy stuff that come with smart phones. So, I decided to purchase 3 more for family. Well, the 3 that I purchased are not excately the "Motorola EX226". I was sent the "Motorola Motokey Social". They look similar, but the difference is the "Motorola Motokey Social" has Facebook as the home key. So, the advertising is a bit missleading. I called the seller and they claimed that this was in fact the EX226 and they all have FB as the home key. I laughed and just sold the phone to someone that could use it with FB.  I give it a 2-star because I was able to sell at least 1 of the 3. I have two more, if someone wants it.

Reviews.Title: RETURNED
Reviews.Author: Ariel Nosrati
Reviews.Content: The Ex I got was defected so I returned it. The screen kept on turning black. What I liked: The camera is very clear, there is very good signal, it comes with wifi, comes with preinstalled games and demos,  and there is wifi included. Don't buy this because you will be taking a risk!What I didn't like: I couldn't get the 3g to work, and it was defected.

Reviews.Title: great affordable phonr
Reviews.Author: LoveAmazon
Reviews.Content: Great phone! The sound is clear. I have taken it to Spain and Ghana and works great. The wifi and radio work well.

Reviews.Title: didn't work properly
Reviews.Author: Luisanna Waggoner
Reviews.Content: battery would not hold charge, touch screen didn't work on every icon. would have loved to keep it if only it had worked

Reviews.Title: Both good and not so good
Reviews.Author: Phil in Baltimore "Baltimore's Best Home Chef...
Reviews.Content: User instructions are sketchy at best. They consist of a one page fold out flyer which is incomplete because it does not address all of the functions. short cuts, "do's and can't do's" as the former more complete manuals. As a retired Motorolan I was shocked to see this poor and incomplete  "documentation".Some positives are it's dual SIM capability, small size, multiple features (if you can figure them out). Unfortunately this is one of the few dual SIM Cell Phones on the market, and it is discontinued at that. I like the flexibility of being able to choose my carrier based on location (traveling or coverage). That feature alone makes it worth the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: Not full 3g support
Reviews.Author: H078
Reviews.Content: Ok as feature phone ... However i used it on AT&T; and even though it has 850MHz 3g band it would stay on Edge all the time

Reviews.Title: Functional good and simple
Reviews.Author: Yifan Lu
Reviews.Content: It works well, and have basic function for my dual sim card from China. It is very small and has reasonable battery duration.But main shortcut is I can't change the language to Chinese, and it lacks of resource for Chinese Rom. So I just returned it.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: comcel
Reviews.Content: Good!! excellent items, its perfect and work excellent this is best good and I think buy more again thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: Cool phone
Reviews.Author: dustin
Reviews.Content: Nice keyboard, responsive screen pad. Has two sim card slots and mini external memory up to 32 gb not included. Must have data plan for this phone do not buy if you are planning to use with wifi only like i was.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, slim design. Terrible OS
Reviews.Author: James K.
Reviews.Content: I got this phone because I was looking for a simple, slim phone with a keyboard and two sims. I had previously been using an older Huwaei with Android 2.3. The phone looks and feels great. But I couldn't get past the operating system. It is simply ridiculous trying to navigate through that thing when one is used to Android. I have no problem with a simple system like those found on really chap phones... they work well and are intuitive. This thing though, it's some primitive stage in the evolution of modern operating systems and it is seriously backward. Also, it's nice that it has the touchscreen option, but for many things it actually forces you to use it, there is no keyboard alternative. I didn't like that at all. I ended up giving the phone away and buying a phone for four times the price just to have Android Jellybean.

Reviews.Title: Enjoyed
Reviews.Author: Neil Smith
Reviews.Content: Got this as a "good job" reward for an employee.  They have enjoyed the experience of having the full qwerty keyboard and facebook access.

Reviews.Title: Dissappointed
Reviews.Author: Dezi "Desi"
Reviews.Content: It have tried repeatedly to use this phone. I really decided that it was too awkward and tedious  and gave it away. I text a lot it really is not a texters phone. Despite having put in address book it would not show the names when the text messages were received. Still trying to find a phone that I will like.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENTE
Reviews.Author: Rodolfo Viloria
Reviews.Content: MUY BUENO EL PRODUCTO Y LOS SERVICIOS DEL VENDEDOR COMO NINGÚN OTRO DE MI PARTE ES ALTAMENTE RECOMENDADO SENORES SERVICIO DE PRIMERA CALIDAD

Reviews.Title: My expectation notreach!
Reviews.Author: Mhike
Reviews.Content: My expectation to this unit are not reach and the simcard slot is not working!The unit itself is not in good working condition!

Reviews.Title: Good phone, I like the dual SIM capability
Reviews.Author: Gabriele Tedoldi
Reviews.Content: I normally go back to Italy once per year so having the dual SIM capability is important for me. The phone is pretty good but don't have all the goodies of other devices. There is a basic Internet capability that i have used while abroad but it's ok for what I need and most importantly with the contract with AT&T; I am not charged for data usage.

Reviews.Title: Save your money
Reviews.Author: Vincent
Reviews.Content: It worked well during the short time it was in  operation; however, it soon completely ceased to function. Overall, my purchase of this cellphone was a waste of money and time.

Reviews.Title: LACKS MANY FEATURES
Reviews.Author: SAMAR GHANDOUR
Reviews.Content: IT FAST IN CONNECTIONWIFI IS FASTTHE SCREEN IS GOODTHE SCREEN IS ALMOST SCRATCH RESISTANTTHIS PRODUCT DOES NOT HAVE MULTIPLE SELECTIONS IN NEARLY ALL OF ITS OPTIONS.IT DOES NOT ALLOW YOU TO SEND MMSTHIS PHONE DOES NOT ALLOW YOU TO CHANGE YOU SCREEN, RING TONE OR ANY OTHER RESPONDING OPTIONS.HAS A VERY SMALL STORAGE CAPACITY. WILL HOLD EXTREMELY LIMITED AMOUNT OF MUSIC, PROBALLY TEN AND NO MORE.THE BATTERY TIME IS SHORTER THAN STATED.VERY DIFFICULT TO SET YOUR TIME ZONE. IT HAS BEN DESIGNED FOR USE OUTSIDED THE US I BELIEVE

Reviews.Title: Very Very Good
Reviews.Author: Peautre Robinson
Reviews.Content: This phone is a good buy Wi Fi social media internetaccess all very good easy to understand. Light weightfit into our pocket

Reviews.Title: Exllcent
Reviews.Author: Mabel osei fosu
Reviews.Content: I always love this specially Motorola product very good to use ,battery good last long and a good phone t

Reviews.Title: beautiful phone
Reviews.Author: cirllee
Reviews.Content: this phone is super light, allows me to listen to local stations and is unlocked to use anywhere i go. has been great so far

Reviews.Title: motorrola ex226
Reviews.Author: katie young
Reviews.Content: this were not a good buy it were hard to operate hard to use text touch screen did do right when touch

Reviews.Title: This phone is not what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Elena Acosta
Reviews.Content: You need to have two sim cards in order to really be able to use it. I couldn't open pictures. Not worth the money

Reviews.Title: Motorola EX226 Unlocked GSM Phone w/ Dual Sim
Reviews.Author: Kerry C. Fitzgibbons
Reviews.Content: I like this phone a lot.  It is very slim and light weight.  The keys are responsive, although small.The organization of the screens take getting used to.For the first week or so this phone kept resetting the language back to Vietnamese, which was not helpful.However, since i understand a little Vietnamese, resetting it to English was not hard.  It now seems to have accepted that English is the default language.I loaned the phone to a guest (we are living overseas), since their US phones would not work here.  They found it very easy to use.  Texting is very simple and very affordable here,and it makes texting internationally very easy and affordable.I would recommend tis phone for travelers.Of course, I bought it for under $60.00 USD  and I see now it is selling for $89.00 USDUpdate of my review:  I have had the phone now for threemonths.  There are some aspects of this phone that could be refined. The instruction manuel is not very helpful in some aspects; there be more clarity about settings.When answering an incoming call, the caller might hangup before you get through all the screens to answer the call.Still all in all, I like the phone; it is very small and easy to carry in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: no lo tengo
Reviews.Author: MARIA APARCEDO
Reviews.Content: decepcionada y apenada a la vez por que lo compre hace mas de un mes y no me ha LLEGADO, estoy muy  molesta por la irresponsabilidad de LIBERTY EXPRESS, cuando algún día me llegue con gusto cambiare mi opinon y hablaremos de la ventajas y desventajas
